alert.note: Alert for Baca; Bent; Kiowa; Las Animas; Otero; Prowers (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 4:39PM MST until February 22 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Otero County in southeastern Colorado... Western Prowers County in southeastern Colorado... Northwestern Baca County in southeastern Colorado... Kiowa County in southeastern Colorado... Northeastern Las Animas County in southeastern Colorado... Bent County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 530 PM MST. * At 438 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 10 miles east of Kit Carson to near Queens Reservoir to 20 miles northwest of Pritchett, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. Highway 50, east of La Junta to the Colorado and Kansas state line will be significantly impacted. Locations impacted include... Lamar, La Junta, North La Junta, Las Animas, Eads, Granada, Wiley, Sheridan Lake, Neeoshe Reservoir, McClave, Chivington, Higbee, Brandon, Blue Lake, Towner, Bristol, Sweetwater Reservoir, Hasty, Neegronda Reservoir and Queens Reservoir. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT

area.areaDesc: Baca; Bent; Kiowa; Las Animas; Otero; Prowers
